Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: CONCLUSIONS : Most patients with cTnI elevations meet CK - MB criteria for MI , as well as have a high incidence of underlying significant disease .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| cTnI |
| CK - MB |

In this paragraph, "cTnI" and "CK - MB" are the chemical entities mentioned. "cTnI" refers to cardiac troponin I, a protein biomarker used to diagnose myocardial injury, while "CK - MB" refers to creatine kinase MB isoenzyme, another biomarker used to diagnose myocardial damage.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| cTnI |
| CK - MB |

In the given paragraph, only "cTnI" and "CK - MB" are clearly identified as chemical entities. They are proteins and biomarkers, respectively, used for diagnosing myocardial injury and damage.
